review.title: Axiomatic Foundations for a Class of Generalized Expected Utility: Algebraic Expected Utility
review.abstract: Expected Utility: Algebraic Expected Utility In this paper, we provide two axiomatizations of algebraic expected utility, which is a particular generalized expected utility, in a von Neumann-Morgenstern setting, i.e. uncertainty representation is supposed to be given and here to be described by a plausibility measure valued on a semiring, which could be partially ordered. We show that axioms identical to those for expected utility entail that preferences are represented by an algebraic expected utility. This algebraic approach allows many previous propositions (expected utility, binary possibilistic utility,...) to be unified in a same general framework and proves that the obtained utility enjoys the same nice features as expected utility: linearity, dynamic consistency, autoduality of the underlying uncertainty measure, autoduality of the decision criterion and possibility of modeling decision maker's attitude toward uncertainty.

sections.text: In this paper we present two axiomatizations of the algebraic expected benefit, which is a certain generalized expected benefit in a NeumannMorgenstern environment, i.e. the representation of uncertainty should be given and described here by a plausibility measure that is evaluated on a semicircle and could be partially ordered. We show that axioms that are identical to those of the expected benefit have the effect that preferences are represented by an algebraic expected benefit. This algebraic approach makes it possible to unify many earlier proposals (expected benefit, binary possible benefit,...) in a general framework and proves that the achieved benefit enjoys the same beautiful properties as the expected benefit: linearity, dynamic consistency, autoduality of the underlying uncertainty representation, autoduality of the decision criterion, and the possibility to model the decision maker's attitude to uncertainty.

sections.heading: 6 CONCLUSION
sections.text: We have provided two axiomatic justifications for a class of general expected usefulness, which we called algebraic expected usefulness. Our second axiomatization is of particular interest. Although it requires two solubility conditions, it is based on simple and natural axioms (prearrangement, non-triviality, weak independence and continuity), similar to those in Machina (1988) for the EU. Our general algebraic approach has enabled the unification of all predicted usefulness in an equal formalization. An algebraic expected usefulness can be constructed from any uncertain representation that meets our conditions, which is of particular interest to uncertainty representation, for which decision models have not yet been proposed. We have shown that the standard expected usefulness as a special case enjoys the EU.
